episodes.title: Kenneth Copeland: Inside the Life of the World's Richest Preacher
episodes.description:
Kenneth Copeland is an American televangelist who is infamous for his preaching of prosperity gospel, the belief that God rewards those loyal to him with material riches. As the years have gone by his reputation as a larger-than-life personality has grown - along with the list of victims who he's conned out of millions of dollars.

This video is a brief recap of the history of Kenneth Copeland ministries. It goes over the backstory of founder Kenneth Copeland and how he's gained a reputation as a charlatan.

Anomaly is on Patreon! Sign up today for insider information, behind-the-scenes footage, and more: https://www.patreon.com/AnomalyDocumentaries

Thank you as always for watching. All sourced footage is the property of its original publisher.

episodes.title: The Rise of Romana Didulo
episodes.description:
Romana Didulo started calling herself the Queen of Canada in 2021, latching onto popular internet conspiracy theories as she built a massive following of supporters. Over time Romana has ordered her followers to stop paying their bills, send cease-and-desists to government offices, and even arrest an entire police force. So how did she get so popular, especially amongst the sovereign citizen movement?

Anomaly is on Patreon! Sign up today for insider information, behind-the-scenes footage, and more: https://www.patreon.com/AnomalyDocumentaries

Thank you as always for watching. All sourced footage is the property of its original publisher.

episodes.title: Sylvia Browne (Documentary)
episodes.description:
Sylvia Browne was once the best known television psychic in America, appearing on daytime talkshows like Montel through the 1990s and 2000s. Despite a folksy image carefully cultivated by Sylvia, the duplicitous life she secretly led came back to haunt her after a string of horribly wrong predictions.

episodes.title: Clonaid (Documentary)
episodes.description:
Clonaid became famous in the early 2000s when the organization announced their intention to clone human beings. It was soon learned the group behind the claims had ties to a UFO religion dating back to the 1970s.

episodes.title: Ashtar Sheran (Documentary)
episodes.description:
Ashtar Sheran and the Universe People are some of the most mysterious entities to appear on the Internet, hosted on an iconic and bizarre Czech website filled with cryptic messages. At a first glance, it's seemingly impossible to untangle where the movement began or what it means. It turns out the answer is much older - and from farther away - than  expected. 

Don't forget to subscribe to Anomaly, and follow us on Twitter: https://www.twitter.com/AnomalyDocs

And we now have a Discord!
https://discord.gg/vYwgR2﻿
